intro: Spergularia rubra var. campestris, commonly known as red sandspurry, is a flowering plant in the family Caryophyllaceae. It is characterized by its prostrate growth habit and produces small, pink to red flowers with five petals. The plant has hairy stems and leaves that are typically alternate and linear. It thrives in disturbed soils and is often found in fields, roadsides, and other open habitats. Spergularia rubra var. campestris is adapted to dry conditions and is commonly found in temperate regions.
